page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: { Swillington}is a small village, with appr. population 4,000, 7 miles S.E.of {Leeds}on the A642 Wakefield-York road. {Swillington}has developed on each side of the main road. It has passed through 3 stages of development. Until the end of the 19th century the main occupation was{agriculture,}followed by a period of{coal-mining}which ceased in 1971, to be replaced by {open-cast mining.} It is now chiefly a residential area with people commuting to nearby centres of employment such as{Leeds {and Wakefield.}The two basic industries in the village are Rocol, which produces oils, and Armitage's brickworks. There are 3 churches, 1 primary school with nursery, 1 restaurant, a variety of small shops 2 clubs and a recreation ground.
